Package autumn.util

Class FileIO

java.lang.Object
autumn.util.FileIO
public final class FileIO extends Object
This class provides a few static utility methods for dealing with files.

Warning: This class is still under development.

Author:
Mackenzie High

  • Method Details

    • filesOf

      public static Set<File> filesOf(File root, boolean recur)
      This method creates an iterable whose iterator can iterate over all the files in a directory.

      If recur is true, sub-directories will be returned before their contents.

      Parameters:
      root - is the directory to iterate over.
      recur - is true, if the sub-directories transversed.
      Returns:
      the aforedescribed iterator.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if root is not a directory.

    • writeText

      public static void writeText(File file, CharSequence data) throws IOException
      This method sets the contents of a text file.

      This method uses the default encoding.

      Parameters:
      file - is the path to the text file.
      data - is value to assign to the text file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if something goes wrong.

    • writeText

      public static void writeText(File file, CharSequence data, Charset charset) throws IOException
      This method sets the contents of a text file.
      Parameters:
      file - is the path to the text file.
      data - is value to assign to the text file.
      charset - is the encoding to use.
      Throws:
      IOException - if something goes wrong.

    • writeLines

      public static void writeLines(File file, Iterable<? extends CharSequence> lines, Charset charset) throws IOException
      This method sets the contents of a text file.
      Parameters:
      file - is the path to the text file.
      lines - are the lines of data to assign to the text file.
      charset - is the encoding to use.
      Throws:
      IOException - if something goes wrong.

    • writeBytes

      public static void writeBytes(File file, byte[] data) throws IOException
      This method sets the contents of a binary file.
      Parameters:
      file - is the path to the binary file.
      data - is value to assign to the binary file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if something goes wrong.

    • readLines

      public static List<String> readLines(File file) throws IOException
      This method reads all the lines of a text file into a list of strings.
      Parameters:
      file - is the file to read.
      Returns:
      a list containing the lines as strings.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist or is unreadable.

    • readLines

      public static List<String> readLines(File file, Charset charset) throws IOException
      This method reads all the lines of a text file into a list of strings.
      Parameters:
      file - is the file to read.
      charset - is the encoding of the file.
      Returns:
      a list containing the lines as strings.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist or is unreadable.

    • readText

      public static String readText(File file) throws IOException
      This method reads a text file into a string.
      Parameters:
      file - is the file to read.
      Returns:
      the content of the file as a string.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist or is unreadable.

    • readText

      public static String readText(File file, Charset charset) throws IOException
      This method reads a text file into a string.
      Parameters:
      file - is the file to read.
      charset - is the encoding of the file.
      Returns:
      the content of the file as a string.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist or is unreadable.

    • readBytes

      public static byte[] readBytes(File file) throws IOException
      This method reads a binary file into an array of bytes.
      Parameters:
      file - is the file to read.
      Returns:
      the content of the file as an array of bytes.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist or is unreadable.
